page.title: 19BONFIRE NIGHT
page.content: We all look forward to Bonfire night. First the funfair arrives on the Common and the final touches are put to the 25ft bonfire. The evening starts with a torchlight procession through the village lead by a local band. When we reach the Common the people with torches stand round the bonfire and chant "REMEMBER, REMEMBER, THE FIFTH OF NOVEMBER..." then all the torches are thrown on the fire. The flames soon reach Guy Fawkes and it gets so hot we all have to move back. After a firework display we have hot potatoes and roast lamb rolls and enjoy ourselves at the funfair. These bonfire celebrations were started 27 years ago by a group called the Bonfire Boys. The Cranleigh Lions now organize the event and the money raised goes to the Village Community fund.
